questions.question: What is the key benefit of using React Router in a React application?
options: Improved performance
Enhanced security
Client-side routing and navigation
Simplified component rendering

questions.question: What is state in React used for?
options: Styling components
Handling user interactions
Storing and managing data within a component
Defining routes in the application

questions.question: What is the role of a reducer in Redux?
options: To define the structure of the application's UI
To manage routing in the application
To specify how the application's state changes in response to actions
To handle user authentication

questions.question: What is the purpose of the `componentDidMount` lifecycle method in a class component?
options: To initialize the component's state
To update the component's state when it mounts
To perform actions after the component has been rendered to the DOM
To handle user interactions

questions.question: What is the purpose of the `map` function in React when rendering lists of data?
options: To create animations in the user interface
To define the styling of list elements
To transform each item in the list and render it in the UI
To handle user interactions within a list

questions.question: What is the purpose of the `componentWillUnmount` lifecycle method in a class component?
options: To initialize the component's state
To handle user input events
To perform cleanup tasks before the component unmounts
To define the component's UI structure

questions.question: What is the purpose of the `useEffect` hook in React?
options: To manage component state
To handle user authentication
To perform side effects in functional components
To define the component's initial state

questions.question: What is a higher-order component (HOC) in React?
options: A component with a higher number of child components
A component that encapsulates other components to share behavior
A component with a more complex UI structure
A component that is rendered above all other components in the hierarchy

questions.question: What is the purpose of the `render` method in a React component?
options: To perform asynchronous operations
To update the component's state
To define the component's UI structure
To handle user input

questions.question: What is the significance of the `props` object in React components?
options: It stores the component's internal state
It allows components to communicate and pass data
It handles routing in a React application
It defines the component's methods

questions.question: What is JSX in React?
options: A JavaScript library
A syntax extension for JavaScript
A package manager
A CSS preprocessor

questions.question: What is the fundamental building block of React apps?
options: Components
Blocks
Elements
Effects

questions.question: What does Redux provide in a React application?
options: A way to style components
A state management solution for handling application data
A built-in testing framework
A router for navigation

questions.question: What is the purpose of the `useState` hook in React?
options: To handle side effects in functional components
To define the component's initial state in a class component
To manage state in functional components
To define routes in a React application

questions.question: What is the significance of the `key` prop when rendering lists in React?
options: It is used to add styles to list items
It helps React identify each item uniquely in the list and optimize rendering
It defines the order of items in the list
It controls the visibility of list items
